meanings.definition: To disturb the stability or equilibrium of
meanings.sent1: Running too fast can unbalance your body.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake unbalanced the fragile structure.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many things at once can unbalance even the most skilled performer.
meanings.sent4: His unexpected confession unbalanced her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The sudden gust of wind unbalanced the umbrella, sending it flying.

meanings.sent1: The unbalance in the budget caused financial stress.
meanings.sent2: The unbalance of power led to conflicts within the group.
meanings.sent3: The unbalance in the seesaw made it impossible for the children to play.
meanings.sent4: The unbalance in her thoughts made it hard for her to make a decision.
meanings.sent5: The unbalance of flavors in the dish left a strange taste in his mouth.
